gurmukhi: qiRpurwNqk Air kyq kih cK Air bhur aucwr ] nwm skl ey bwn ky lIjhu su kib suDwr ]218]
transliteration: Tripuraantak Ar(i) Ket Kah(i) Chakh Ar(i) Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Sakal E Baan Ke Leejoh Su Kabi Sudhaar||218||
translation: If after saying the words “Tripurantak and Ariketu” and then uttering “Chakshu-ari”, then the poets know all the names of Baan correctly.218.

gurmukhi: kwrqkyA ipqu piRQm kih Air Duj nyqR bKwn ] Air pd bhur bKwnIAY nwm bwn pihcwn ]219]
transliteration: Kaartakea Pit(u) Pritham Kah(i) Ar(i) Dhuj Netrabakhaan|| Ar(i) Pad Bahur Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Paihchaan||219||
translation: All the names of Baan are recognized by uttering the words “Kaartikya nd Pitra” in the beginning and then saying and adding the words “Ari-Dhvaj, Netar and Ari”.219.

gurmukhi: ibrl bYir kr bwrhw bhulwNqk blvwn ] brxwqk blhw ibsK bIr pqn brbwn ]220]
transliteration: Biral Bair(i) Kar Baar-haa Bahulaantak Balvaan|| Barnaatak Balhaa Bisakh Beer Patan Barbaan||220||
translation: “Vairi, Vilarkar, Baar-ha, Bohlantak, Varnanaantak, Balha, Vishikh, Veerpatan etc.” are all spoken of as the names of Baan.220.

gurmukhi: piRQm sll kO nwm lY Dr Air bhur bKwn ] kyq c`C Air aucrIAY nwm bwn ky jwn ]221]
transliteration: Pritham Salal Kau Naam Lai Dhar Ar(i) Bahur Bakhaan|| Ket Chachchh Ar(i) Ouchreeai Naam Baan Ke Jaan||221||
translation: Uttering the word “Salil” (water) in the beginning, saying and adding eh words “Dhar, Ari Ketu, Chakshu and Ari”, the names of Baan are known.221.

gurmukhi: kwrqkyA pd piRQm kih ipqu Air kyq aucwr ] cK Air kih sB bwn ky lIjhu nwm suDwr ]222]
transliteration: Kaartakea Pad Pritham Kah(i) Pit(u) Ar(i) Ket Ouchaar|| Chakh Ar(i) Kah(i) Sabh Baan Ke Leejoh Naam Sudhaar||222||
translation: All the names of Baan are spoken correctly by saying the word “Kaartikya in the beginning and then saying and adding the words “Pitra, Ari, Ketu, Chakshu and Ari” in serial order.222.

gurmukhi: piRQm ipnwkI pwn kih irp Duj ciK puin dyhu ] skl nwm sRI bwn ky cIn cqur icq lyhu ]223]
transliteration: Pritham Pinaakipaankah(i) Rip Dhuj Chakh(i) Poun(i) Deh(u)|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Cheen Chatur Chit Leh(u)||223||
translation: The wise people may comprehend all the names of Baan in their mind by uttering “Pinaaki-paani in the beginning and then adding Ripdhvaj and Chakshu.”223.

gurmukhi: psu piq surDr Air aucir Duj ciK S`qRu bKwn ] skl nwm sRI bwn ky cqur ic`q mY jwn ]224]
transliteration: Pasu Pat(i) Surdhar Ar(i) Ouchar(i) Dhuj Chakh(i) Shattru Bakhaan|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Chatur Chit Mai Jaan||224||
translation: Uttering the words “Pashupati, Surdhar and Ari” and then saying the words “Dhvaj-Chakshu and Shatru”, all the names of Baan are known by the wise people.224.

gurmukhi: pwrbqIs Air kyq ciK kih irp pun pd dyhu ] skl nwm sRI bwn ky cIn cqur icq lyhu ]225]
transliteration: Paarbatees Ar(i) Ket Chakh(i) Kah(i) Rip Poun Pad Deh(u)|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Cheen Chatur Chit Leh(u)||225||
translation: After uttering the words “Parvteesh, Ariketu and Chakshu and then adding the wrord “Ripu”, the wise people know all the names of Baan.225.

gurmukhi: SsqR swNg swmur clq S`qRu mwn ko Kwp ] skl jIqI iqsY jpIAqu qwN ko jwp ]226]
transliteration: Shastra Saan Saamuh Chalat Shattru Maan Ko Khaap|| Sakal Srishat Jeetitisai Japeeat(u) Taan Ko Jaap||226||
translation: Even with the continued blows of the weapons and lances etc. on the front, the weapons which destroys the ego of the enemy, that has conquered the whole world; I only utter its name in devotion.226.

gurmukhi: skl SMBu ky nwm lY Air Duj nyqR bKwn ] skl nwm sRI bwn ky inksq clq ApRmwn ]227]
transliteration: Sakal Shanbh(u) Ke Naam Lai Ar(i) Dhuj Netra Bakhaan|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Niksat Chalat Apramaan||227||
translation: Saying all the names of Shambhoo (Shiva) and then uttering the words “Ari, Dhvaj and Netar”, all the names of Baan continue to be encolved.227.

gurmukhi: piRQm nwm lY S`qRu ko Ardn bhur aucwr ] skl nwm sRI bwn ky inksq clY Apwr ]228]
transliteration: Pritham Naam Lai Shattru Ko Ardan Bahur Ouchaar|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Niksat Chalat Apaar||228||
translation: Uttering the world “Shatru” in the beginning and then saying the word “Ardan”, all the names of Baan continue to be evolved.228.

gurmukhi: skl miRgw Sbdwid kih Ardn pd kih AMq ] skl nwm sRI bwn ky inksq clYN AnMq ]229]
transliteration: Sakal Mrigad Shabadaadh Kah(i) Ardan Pad Kah(i) Ant|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Niksat Chalain Anant||229||
translation: Saying all the names of related to “Mrig” (deer) in the beginning and uttering the word “Ardan” at the end, all the names of Baan continue to be evolved.229.

gurmukhi: kuMBkrn pd Awid kih Ardn bhur bKwn ] skl nwm sRI bwn ky cqur ic`q mY jwn ]230]
transliteration: Kounbhkaran Pad Aadh Kah(i) Ardan Bahur Bakhaan|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Chatur Chitt Mai Jaan||230||
translation: The wise men comprehend all the names of Baan by uttering the word “Kumbhkaran” in the beginning and then saying the word “Ardan”.230.

gurmukhi: irp smudR pd piRQm kih kwnir BwXo AMq ] skl nwm sRI bwn ky inksq clih AnMq ]231]
transliteration: Rip Samudra Pad Pritham Kah(i) Kaanar(i) Bhaakho Ant|| Sakal Naam Sribaan Ke Niksat Chaleh Anant||231||
translation: Uttering the word “Rip-Samudra” in the beginning and then saying the word “Kaanari” at the end, innumerable names of Baan get evolved.231.
